page.title: 05Buildings in West Ashby.
page.content: Noteworthy buildings include W.Ashby House, erected in 1840.It has a carved doorway said to have come from the London home of Captain Cook.The Grove is an 18roomed rambling house with 17 chimneys.Itwas erected after the enclosure act and built by William Elmhirst on land previously owned by the Bishop of Carlisle, but given to Mr. Elmhirst at his request instead of payment for his work on the enclosures The Manor House was built in 1840 in gardens overlooking a lake formed by the River Waring.The Village Hall was built by public subscription and opened in 1958.In addition to it's general use it became headquarters of the W.I.
